department_name: Environmental Management Department - Environmental Health Division

grading_system.description: El Dorado County conducts routine inspections and provides inspection reports, but specific grading methodology (letter grades, numerical scores, or pass/fail) could not be verified from available sources

inspection_details.frequency: Routine inspections of permitted food facilities conducted by Environmental Health Division
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Food facility complaints and compliance issues trigger investigations and follow-up inspections
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Inspection reports available for review at facilities; copies obtainable through Records Request to Environmental Management Division

facility_safety_authority.department_name: El Dorado County Fire Protection District and multiple local fire agencies including El Dorado Hills Fire Department
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: Commercial kitchen hood fire suppression systems required per NFPA standards - semi-annual inspections required
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual (every 6 months) per NFPA 96 requirements for commercial kitchen hood suppression systems

regulatory_framework.food_code_basis: California Retail Food Code (CRFC) - California Health and Safety Code, Division 104, Part 7
regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County level - El Dorado County Environmental Health Division conducts inspections
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: County follows California Retail Food Code with local permit requirements through Environmental Management Department

confidence_notes: Verified county-level authority, department structure, regulatory framework, and fire safety requirements. However, specific grading methodology (letter grades vs numerical scores vs pass/fail) could not be determined from available sources.
verification_notes: Manual verification needed for: 1) Specific grading system type and methodology, 2) Score ranges and grade thresholds if applicable, 3) Detailed inspection frequency schedules, 4) Risk-based categorization system if used. Contact Environmental Health Division at 530-621-5300 for definitive grading system information.
